Class Conversation

java.lang.Object
  Conversation

public class Conversation
extends Object

This class implements a simple multiple-choice based conversation between an NPC and the player. It works by keeping HashMap of replies where each reply contains:
1) the NPC's part of the conversation, and
2) the choices of responses by the Player
The conversation ends when:
1) the Player enters an invalid choice and the NPC gets confused, OR
2) the conversation comes to an end with a reply from the NPC containing sign-off text.

See the ConversationTest class for an example of how to use this class.

Version:
2012.04.18
Author:
Maria Jump

                    String theSignoff)
Constructor for objects of class Conversation

Parameters:
theName - The name of the NPC
theSignoff - The custom sign-off text
Method Detail

addReply

public void addReply(String keyword,
                     String reply)
Add a reply to the choices of replies that the NPC can make. Each reply should either contains the sign-off text (to end the conversation), or provide multiple-choice responses for the Player (this is a simple conversation scenario and one we can do easily). See the text in the startConversation method comment as an example.

Parameters:
keyword - The keyword for each reply.
reply - The associated reply.

startConversation

public String startConversation(String key)
This method uses the replies you set up using the addReply method to have a conversation with the player. For example: Sam: My job here is to help you win. So what can I do for you? A: You can give me the key that I need. B: You can make it so that I win the game right now. C: You can go jump off a bridge. Enter the letter of your response: B Sam: That's easy ... you win! Goodbye.

Parameters:
key - The keyword that starts the conversation.
Returns:
The key at the stop of the conversation so the game can react if appropriate.
